intro: Lactuca dentata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf lettuce, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and have a slightly bitter taste. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it both a wild plant and a potential forage species for livestock.
